Nota negativissima: dura 1 ora!!!! Fate un EDT per favore</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="628408"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=628408#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent611756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc611756" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma611756ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd611756" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-12">07/12/15 15:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In terms of smell this stuff is amazing. What lets it down is the longevity. On my skin it seems to last 2 hours before going completely. Its a very simple barbershop style fragrance. People often remark on how nice the fruit smells in this cologne. I seem to get many compliments when wearing this fragrance. Its slightly disappointing that the lasting power is not so great. However it smells amazing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="611756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=611756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent586450" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc586450" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kensai7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879181"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.879181.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kensai7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Terre-d-Hermes-17.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Terre d'Herms"title="Terre d'Herms"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma586450ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd586450" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/879181">Kensai7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-16">04/16/15 01:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first tried Douro when it was still Lord's, although the story goes that is was called Douro Eau de Portugal back in 1911 when it was first created. My father used to wear it a lot and I was trying it myself as well. This is a classic lavender and citrus aroma that cannot go wrong. Great as an evening aroma, regardless if you wear jeans or tuxedo!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="586450"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=586450#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent514773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc514773" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma514773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd514773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-18">08/18/14 08:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Douro is an aromatic with a touch of the classic fougere about it. <br />
For me it's a pleasant fragrance and worthy (and expected) to be in the penhaligon's line but one of my least favourite.<br />
Nothing offensive about I just think it's not herbal enough, not spicy or mossy enough, put simply Douro is just not ballsy enough.<br />
 The composition has the balance of other similar Penhaligon's scents which is usually a positive thing but dare I say it makes Douro a tad on the boring side.<br />
Opens, with fresh bergamot, citrus classic note of lavender, then becomes a slightly, floral mossy, musk. <br />
Nothing jumps out at me, but not offensive by any means.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="514773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=514773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent462664" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc462664" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma462664ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd462664" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-02">03/02/14 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I probably should have done a side-by-side with Tiffany, Chanel PM, and PMC, based on forum comments. Initially very promising, it opens with a pleasant (non-acidic, non-fizzy) lemon over anisy barbershop-type spices, a top that I'd expect to herald a good wood scent farther along. It seems to get a bit weaker after the first few minutes and the lemon gets duller, sweeter and more powdery, like a lemon analog of the orange in Habit Rouge. It develops just the slightest bit of "wild/english fern" type herbal green in the mid notes, and initially remains more spice-oriented than that group, until the spices recede more and the ferny-ness becomes more apparent. In the end, I feel like I'm left with a sweet spice/wood scent that would be really great if not for the intrusion of powdery, anisy and ferny notes which I would prefer not to have. Their Opus 1870, while built around a different selection of wood notes (more cedar), feels more uncontaminated to me because they've chosen ancillary notes that don't bother me as much:  sharper spices and maybe a little fruit.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="462664"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=462664#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent438036" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc438036" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Grottola"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47939.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Grottola" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma438036ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd438036" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939">Grottola</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-20">12/20/13 19:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Was Sartorial born from Douro?<br />
<br />
No, seriously, check this out - Douro is an idea that I'm surprised hasn't been executed more.  It's a chypre and a fougere crossed.  The mossy-woody citrus/resin/lichen chypre quality is there, but the fantastic lavender/coumarin fougere accord that makes Sartorial so great is thrown in the mix, albeit much more subtle.  Surprisingly, these elements don't clash, and what results is an incredibly smooth, almost seamless barbershop-esque masculine that doesn't smell too dated nor overpowering.  I actually wish it were a bit stronger, but hey, it gets the job done.  Good stuff.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="438036"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=438036#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent319951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc319951" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Go4broke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/283374"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.283374.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Go4broke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sean-John/Unforgivable-2209.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2209.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unforgivable"title="Unforgivable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma319951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd319951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/283374">Go4broke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-31">12/31/12 07:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a nice clean toilet. That is all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="319951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=319951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent249032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc249032" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma249032ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd249032" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-05-08">05/08/12 11:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Review for the 2004 edition of Douro:<br />
<br />
Not exactly old-school but more sort of "old-school-inspired" citrus aromatic with the usual lavender presence and a slightly synthetic, kinda mossy, vibe. Not terrifying as I expected but let's put it like this: if I should compile a list of my 100 favorite fragrances, Douro would be #83.257.<br />
<br />
Note: The original Douro (Eau De Portugal) was released in 1985. The same year when the world got its first contact with Derby, Poison, Caron Le 3me Homme, Sables, Lauder For Men, Green irish Tweed...Hard times for minor fragrances.<br />
<br />
Rating: 5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="249032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=249032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent229843" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc229843" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sbhammer73"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/159624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.159624.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sbhammer73" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5672.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Douro"title="Douro"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma229843ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd229843" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/159624">sbhammer73</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-03-04">03/04/12 02:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of the classiest "old school" barbershop fragrances out there. Absolutely love it !</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="229843"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=229843#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent148346" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc148346" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TankGirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/29456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.29456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TankGirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma148346ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd148346" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/29456">TankGirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-17">05/17/11 14:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Douro is the name of the most beautifull river in Portugal :) The river divided a valey surronded by grapevines, my grandfather family has a big farm in there and the landscape is awesome! I never smelled this fragrance but now I want to!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="148346"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=148346#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent148339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc148339" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oslo-fjord"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/52140"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.52140.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oslo-fjord" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Fahrenheit-228.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.228.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fahrenheit"title="Fahrenheit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma148339ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd148339" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/52140">Oslo-fjord</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-17">05/17/11 14:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the classiest aromatic scents on the marked. Smells very natural. Perfect as an everyday refined/classy fragrance for elegant gentlemen. Great for most occasions and seasons, but probably best for spring and summer. It`s a eau du cologne, so sillage and staying-power could be better..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="148339"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=148339#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent101226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc101226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma101226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd101226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-09-18">09/18/10 08:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very manly, aromatic scent and another superb scent from Penhaligons. I agree this is similar to Navy, yet I find it more of a dress blue type of Navy: deeper, richer and much more refined and very well mixed.<br />
<br />
The lime, lemon and mandarin are balanced quite well by the lavender and geranium, and this a very dry scent despite the citruses. Mint here is more herbal, than fresh and bright. The inclusion of muguet's soft green and neroli's powdery sweetness adds to the virility of this scent; as opposed to detracting from it, as I would have thought. The base is musky but clean, and oakmoss is added in just the right amount to make it earthy/woody without taking over, and the labdanum resin (cistus) makes it feel rich and warmly incensy but not smoky or tacky. I really am impressed by this scent, and now that I have developed a taste for more classic smelling scents, may reach for this often...<br />
<br />
Sillage: very good<br />
Longevity: above average<br />
Overall: 4.25/5<br />
<br />
This has a superb blend of citrus, flowers and aromatics that makes it smell classic and manly, yet fresh and woody, without seeming generic or dated. I read somewhere (I think) that this is the 2004 remake of the original Douro Eau de Portugal, which was a much older vintage PL scent, it has a vintage feel without an 'old man' type of aura to it...worth trying!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="101226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=101226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>

    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent101226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc101226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma101226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd101226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-09-18">09/18/10 08:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very manly, aromatic scent and another superb scent from Penhaligons. I agree this is similar to Navy, yet I find it more of a dress blue type of Navy: deeper, richer and much more refined and very well mixed.<br />
<br />
The lime, lemon and mandarin are balanced quite well by the lavender and geranium, and this a very dry scent despite the citruses. Mint here is more herbal, than fresh and bright. The inclusion of muguet's soft green and neroli's powdery sweetness adds to the virility of this scent; as opposed to detracting from it, as I would have thought. The base is musky but clean, and oakmoss is added in just the right amount to make it earthy/woody without taking over, and the labdanum resin (cistus) makes it feel rich and warmly incensy but not smoky or tacky. I really am impressed by this scent, and now that I have developed a taste for more classic smelling scents, may reach for this often...<br />
<br />
Sillage: very good<br />
Longevity: above average<br />
Overall: 4.25/5<br />
<br />
This has a superb blend of citrus, flowers and aromatics that makes it smell classic and manly, yet fresh and woody, without seeming generic or dated. I read somewhere (I think) that this is the 2004 remake of the original Douro Eau de Portugal, which was a much older vintage PL scent, it has a vintage feel without an 'old man' type of aura to it...worth trying!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="101226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=101226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent958675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc958675" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="monkey500"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1144035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="monkey500" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Essenza-di-Colonia-9829.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9829.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Essenza di Colonia"title="Essenza di Colonia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma958675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd958675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144035">monkey500</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-04">07/04/18 17:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my first Penhaligon's fragrance and I am not disappointed:<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's Douro is bright and clean and fresh 'classic masculine' fragrance that smoothly cuts through hot weather and possesses enough aromatic warmth to stand out in winter. <br />
<br />
Projection is just about where I'd want it to be - within arms length and for a few hours - and longevity is excellent for an Eau de Cologne with a refreshing top up spray around 5pm still very present as a skin scent after 2am; this may be due to the humidity but I'd say it's down to the quality of Penhaligon's ingredients. In cold weather I get at least 8-10 hours.<br />
<br />
Top quality fragrance, great notes for even classy formal occasions and surprising longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="958675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=958675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1404948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1404948" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carlitos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1071323"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1071323.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carlitos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Sauvage-Elixir-68415.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68415.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sauvage Elixir"title="Sauvage Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1404948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1404948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1071323">Carlitos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-05">09/05/21 12:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Long before established rulers, the Douro region was inhabited by primitive peoples. They were the first to engrave their tracks in Iberian rock caves. These paintings in the Ca Valley date from 20,000 years ago. The presence of grape agriculture in the region dates back to 30 centuries ago, as charred seeds were found in local archaeological sites. The Douro River is widely considered to be the northern border of Lusitania, a nation of valiant shepherds and hunters recognized as the first Portuguese.<br />
In the 1st century of our era, the arrival of the Romans intensified agriculture in the region. Thanks to the new stone-paved roads network, as well the numerous bridges that were built at that time, viticulture gained great importance. Agricultural villages emerged, devoted exclusively to wine production.<br />
From the 5th century, the land of the Douro was occupied by Suebi and Visigoths, who eventually unite and Christianize. Muslims followed after the 8th century.<br />
The founding of the Kingdom of Portugal in 1143 is thanks to Afonso Henriques (1109-1185), the first Portuguese king and responsible for the country's independence. In the 12th and 13th centuries, in the Low Middle Ages, monks of the Cistercian order settled in the region. It was an important contribution to local agriculture and several farms were established on the slopes of the Douro River. Slope angle controlled the land management practices, imposing the construction of terraces with schist stone walls. More recently, land embankments have been built in order to create flat surfaces to plant the vines. These structures originated a unique terraced landscape. This beautiful type of landscape still continues to this day.<br />
Wine production continued to develop thanks to easy transport to Porto across the Douro River. The maritime travelling that led to the expansion of the Portuguese Empire around the world (15th and 16th centuries) also contributed to river wine transportation. The long sea journeys to the Far East and South America required large quantities of strong wines to satisfy the adventurous sailors.<br />
Between the 17th and 19th centuries, England became the main consumer of the wines produced in the Douro region, leading to the signing of the Methuen Treaty in 1703. The United Kingdom granted preferential rights to Portuguese wines. In return, Portugal allowed British fabrics free access to the domestic market. The high demand for Douro wines by English traders led to a distortion of the wine quality. Merchants demanding an easy profit seldom mixed high-quality Portuguese wines with cheaper ones.<br />
Prime Minister Marquis of Pombal (1699-1782) would change the economic situation of the region, create the first regulated wine region in the world and delimit the Douro wine region (1757). This inaugurated the exclusivity of the production and marketing of Port Wine in the Douro region.<br />
The landscape of the Douro is quite unique and very beautiful. This change of Nature by humans contributed to the fact that the Douro wine region was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 2001.<br />
Now is the time for a glass of port and a whiff of perfume!<br />
<br />
Douro Eau de Portugal by Penhaligon's is simply a very good perfume that fits the gentleman stereotype; It is fresh, masculine, with non-bubbly citrus fruits, light aniseed barbershop spices and a floral note with notes of lavender, geranium, neroli and lily. It has an exquisite touch that is also present in several other Penhaligon men's fragrances. It's an excellent choice for social settings where the focus is on impressing people with your gentlemanly demeanour rather than yelling, "Hey, I am here, smell my scent!"<br />
Performance is its weakness. It only lasts on my skin for about 4-5 hours before it becomes undetectable. Silage and projection are below average. However, Douro is a good morning perfume for spring and summer days. In the afternoon I can reapply myself or use a different perfume. It can also be suitable for a formal and elegant night event where you want to smell nice but subtle.<br />
I like this Douro. It reminds me a lot of the also very elegant Monsieur de Givenchy original. I just wish this Penhaligon's would last a couple of hours more on my skin. I also want my Port Wine bottles to last a little longer ... the world is not perfect.<br />
<br />
Music: YES - "Soon" (included in the "Relayer" album)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="1404948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=1404948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1128196" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1128196" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noddygoestotoyland"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207914"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1207914.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noddygoestotoyland" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Cuir-de-Russie-Parfum-47794.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47794.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir de Russie Parfum"title="Cuir de Russie Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1128196ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1128196" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207914">Noddygoestotoyland</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-27">12/27/19 10:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The most refined Eau de Portugal out there... and there are several... 4711's... Creed's... Trumper's... Pinaud's...<br />
<br />
Douro being a river, the barbershop owner being a poet and labdanum the lively temperament of a coarse flower. A tender note made out of nature's drama - bitter!<br />
<br />
United, the river the barber and the flower conjure the best Portugals coastline can bind  waves robust enough, killing themselves against the rocks, turned in mist. You walk away from it all, safely, feeling like a gentleman.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="1128196"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=1128196#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1028680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1028680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glamsterdam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182416"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1182416.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glamsterdam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gritti/Antalya-16629.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16629.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Antalya"title="Antalya"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1028680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1028680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182416">Glamsterdam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-02-06">02/06/19 18:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first got this in 2005 when a London colleague gave me 2 small tubes and told me about this great perfume brand. He said I should try it and that I'd only need to apply a little bit as the stuff lasted very long. As I remember he claimed it was because it was(more) oil-based. One was Endymion, the other was Douro and indeed it lasted ALL DAY. (and night)<br />
<br />
Forward to 2018, I'm re-introducing myself with Penhaligons and besides others I bought a bottle of Douro. Perhaps they changed the formula or those vials I got in 2005 were concentrated uber-samples because it doesn't last as long today. <br />
<br />
However, I enjoy Douro very much and it lasts quite long. It does not radiate several meters but who needs that? If you choose Douro, you are already confident and used to radiating with your eyes and presence. Douro is not to bait or draw but to convince and seal.<br />
<br />
Douro is not my immediate Penhaligon favourite and if you aim to score quick compliments maybe something else is better. I rate it as 100% masculine, 100% mature. <br />
<br />
(anyone else seen those Douro "for women" ads from US vendors???)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="1028680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=1028680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="5672" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent719694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc719694" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Black Russian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983477"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.983477.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Black Russian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/V-Canto/Alibi-30645.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30645.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alibi"title="Alibi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma719694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd719694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983477">Black Russian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-01">07/01/16 12:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't hate it, and to say that I dislike it would be a stretch, but it definitely is my least favorite from 10+ Penhaligon's offerings for men that I currently own or had before.<br />
It has not too great opening, than it is OK for about an hour, after that it smells like wet floor just washed with weird soap for about 3 hours, before settling into decent scent that lingers too close to skin to be noticed by anyone who is not within inches from you.<br />
I try it on the paper too, thinking it could be my body chemistry don't go well with it. I guess paper chemistry don't go well with it either - the same result. <br />
I won't buy it again, that's for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5672"comment_id="719694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html?ccid=719694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="5672" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"

                <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Brands</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Lattafa-Perfumes.html" class="en2inter">Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Dior.html" class="en2inter">Dior</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    <script>

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.asia").replace(/designers/, "designer") });
                if (lang == 'NL') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.nl").replace(/designers/, "ontwerper").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'SR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.punmiris.com").replace(/designers/, "dizajner").replace(/perfume/, "parfem") });
                if (lang == 'RO') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
